name: dysmorphism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a condition in which part of the body is a different shape from normal: Clinical examination at age 3 reveals mild facial dysmorphism. A dysmorphism or dysmorphic feature is a major difference in the shape of body part or organ compared to the average shape of that part. Related word
dysmorphicCompare
dysmorphia
More examplesFewer examplesMicrotia of the right ear is present; the left ear is normal, with no other dysmorphism.Further clinical examination revealed cutaneous lesions and facial dysmorphism.Facial dysmorphism is less marked and neonatal seizures are less common in this disease than in Zellweger syndrome.Clinical features included craniofacial dysmorphisms.
